subdisciplines.name: Aerodynamics
subdisciplines.description: The study of airflow and how it affects objects in motion, especially aircraft.

subdisciplines.name: Astrodynamics
subdisciplines.description: The study of the motion of man-made objects in space.

subdisciplines.name: Propulsion
subdisciplines.description: The study of the thrust required to propel vehicles in aerospace.

subdisciplines.name: Structural design
subdisciplines.description: The design of structures that can resist the forces encountered during aircraft operation.

subdisciplines.name: Aerodynamics
subdisciplines.description: The study of the motion of air and other gases, particularly as it relates to the behavior of objects in motion through the atmosphere.

subdisciplines.name: Flight Mechanics and Controls
subdisciplines.description: The study of the dynamics and control of aircraft and spacecraft, including stability and control, guidance and navigation, and flight performance.

subdisciplines.name: Structures and Materials
subdisciplines.description: The study of the materials and structural systems used in the design and construction of aircraft and spacecraft, including analysis, testing, and optimization.

subdisciplines.name: Propulsion and Power
subdisciplines.description: The study of the propulsion systems and power generation systems used in aircraft and spacecraft, including engine design, performance analysis, and fuel consumption optimization.

subdisciplines.name: Astrodynamics
subdisciplines.description: The study of spacecraft trajectories in the context of gravitational forces.

subdisciplines.name: Aerodynamics
subdisciplines.description: The study of the properties of gases in motion, and specifically the interaction between gases and solid or fluid bodies moving through them.
